sect2.para: Moves an HDF5 item from one location to another.

The Move-Item cmdlet moves an item, including its properties, contents, and child items, from one location to another location. The locations must be supported by the same provider. For example, it can move a file or subdirectory from one directory to another or move a registry subkey from one key to another. When you move an item, it is added to the new location and delet ed from its original location.

listitem.para: Specifies the path to the current location of the items. The default is the current directory. Wildcards are permitted.
Specifies the path to the location where the items are being moved. The default is the current directory. Wildcards are permitted, but the result must specify a single location.

sect2.para: Combines a path and a child path into a single path. The provider supplies the path delimiters.
The Join-Path cmdlet combines a path and child-path into a single path. The provider supplies the path delimiters.

listitem.para: Specifies the main path (or paths) to which the child-path is appended. Wildcards are permitted.
Specifies the elements to append to the value of Path. Wildcards are permitted.
Displays the items that are referenced by the joined path.

example.title: Joining paths
example.screen: PS:1 > Join-Path h5tmp: dset* h5tmp:\dset* PS:2 > Join-Path h5tmp: dset* -Resolve h5tmp:\dset1 h5tmp:\dset2 h5tmp:\dset3
